job_title: User Experience Designer in Bristol, England
pros: Great place to work so far. Lots of opportunities to add value with your work. People actually care about working there. Even though there is hierarchy in the business, the directors and senior leaders are all really approachable and easy to talk to. They are trying to improve all the time (really care about employee happiness). There are lots of really great people who work there. Lovely office, but they're flexible with hybrid or remote working. Good benefits package. Just overall a good place to work.
cons: Sometimes, due to the charitable status, things can take a while to get signed off. Teams are still a little siloed. If you're the kind of person who wants a commercial working environment that's super fast-paced then BCS probably isn't for you. The complexity of the business can take a little while to understand.

job_title: N A in Oxford, England
pros: Good pension. Get vegan sweets and crisps  in the mail from time to time.
cons:
Mid to senior level management,  in many areas of the business are detached but demanding, underwhelming and uninspiring. If you want to learn, grow and have great professional mentors to nurture your growth and to guide you, this is not the place to work. 

Complete lack of overt/visible senior leadership in what is a complex organisation fraught with strategic, change and quality issues. Company motto is "being human", it is in fact a cut throat organisation, watch your back. This points to the fact that senior leadership are oblivious to what is going on at ground zero. 

Antiquated systems resulting in days worth of arbitrary manual procces, ironic for an organisation called the British Computer Society. Lack of suitable internal  qualifications in education or assessment, this reflects in the quality of the assessment provision and general lack of process and regulatory awareness. 

New experienced recruits treated as though they have everything to learn from The BCS and nothing to offer in terms of prior experience. If you want to feel great about your work, build on your existing skills and learn about the education sector from those around you, then The BCS will not offer you that platform. 
 
Drab, dated, lacking in innovation, no clear and present, transparent leadership, no clear vision.
